lines.text: Enter ANGELO, ESCALUS, and a Justice, Provost, Officers, and other Attendants, behind

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: We must not make a scarecrow of the law, Setting it up to fear the birds of prey, And let it keep one shape, till custom make it Their perch and not their terror.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Ay, but yet Let us be keen, and rather cut a little, Than fall, and bruise to death. Alas, this gentleman Whom I would save, had a most noble father! Let but your honour know, Whom I believe to be most strait in virtue, That, in the working of your own affections, Had time cohered with place or place with wishing, Or that the resolute acting of your blood Could have attaind the effect of your own purpose, Whether you had not sometime in your life Errd in this point which now you censure him, And pulld the law upon you.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Tis one thing to be tempted, Escalus, Another thing to fall. I not deny, The jury, passing on the prisoners life, May in the sworn twelve have a thief or two Guiltier than him they try. Whats open made to justice, That justice seizes: what know the laws That thieves do pass on thieves Tis very pregnant, The jewel that we find, we stoop and taket Because we see it but what we do not see We tread upon, and never think of it. You may not so extenuate his offence For I have had such faults but rather tell me, When I, that censure him, do so offend, Let mine own judgment pattern out my death, And nothing come in partial. Sir, he must die.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Be it as your wisdom will.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Where is the provost

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Here, if it like your honour.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: See that Claudio Be executed by nine tomorrow morning: Bring him his confessor, let him be prepared For thats the utmost of his pilgrimage.
Exit Provost

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: [Aside]  Well, heaven forgive him! and forgive us all! Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall: Some run from brakes of ice, and answer none: And some condemned for a fault alone.
Enter ELBOW, and Officers with FROTH and POMPEY

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Come, bring them away: if these be good people in a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in common houses, I know no law: bring them away.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: How now, sir! Whats your name and whats the matter

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: If it Please your honour, I am the poor dukes constable, and my name is Elbow: I do lean upon justice, sir, and do bring in here before your good honour two notorious benefactors.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Benefactors Well what benefactors are they are they not malefactors

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: If it please your honour, I know not well what they are: but precise villains they are, that I am sure of and void of all profanation in the world that good Christians ought to have.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: This comes off well heres a wise officer.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Go to: what quality are they of Elbow is your name why dost thou not speak, Elbow

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: He cannot, sir hes out at elbow.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: What are you, sir

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: He, sir! a tapster, sir parcelbawd one that serves a bad woman whose house, sir, was, as they say, plucked down in the suburbs and now she professes a hothouse, which, I think, is a very ill house too.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: How know you that

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: My wife, sir, whom I detest before heaven and your honour,

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: How thy wife

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Ay, sir whom, I thank heaven, is an honest woman,

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Dost thou detest her therefore

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: I say, sir, I will detest myself also, as well as she, that this house, if it be not a bawds house, it is pity of her life, for it is a naughty house.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: How dost thou know that, constable

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Marry, sir, by my wife who, if she had been a woman cardinally given, might have been accused in fornication, adultery, and all uncleanliness there.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: By the womans means

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Ay, sir, by Mistress Overdones means: but as she spit in his face, so she defied him.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, if it please your honour, this is not so.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Prove it before these varlets here, thou honourable man prove it.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Do you hear how he misplaces

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, she came in great with child and longing, saving your honours reverence, for stewed prunes sir, we had but two in the house, which at that very distant time stood, as it were, in a fruitdish, a dish of some threepence your honours have seen such dishes they are not China dishes, but very good dishes,

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Go to, go to: no matter for the dish, sir.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: No, indeed, sir, not of a pin you are therein in the right: but to the point. As I say, this Mistress Elbow, being, as I say, with child, and being greatbellied, and longing, as I said, for prunes and having but two in the dish, as I said, Master Froth here, this very man, having eaten the rest, as I said, and, as I say, paying for them very honestly for, as you know, Master Froth, I could not give you threepence again.

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: No, indeed.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Very well: you being then, if you be remembered, cracking the stones of the foresaid prunes,

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: Ay, so I did indeed.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Why, very well I telling you then, if you be remembered, that such a one and such a one were past cure of the thing you wot of, unless they kept very good diet, as I told you,

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: All this is true.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Why, very well, then,

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Come, you are a tedious fool: to the purpose. What was done to Elbows wife, that he hath cause to complain of Come me to what was done to her.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, your honour cannot come to that yet.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: No, sir, nor I mean it not.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, but you shall come to it, by your honours leave. And, I beseech you, look into Master Froth here, sir a man of fourscore pound a year whose father died at Hallowmas: wast not at Hallowmas, Master Froth

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: Allhallond eve.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Why, very well I hope here be truths. He, sir, sitting, as I say, in a lower chair, sir twas in the Bunch of Grapes, where indeed you have a delight to sit, have you not

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: I have so because it is an open room and good for winter.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Why, very well, then I hope here be truths.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: This will last out a night in Russia, When nights are longest there: Ill take my leave. And leave you to the hearing of the cause Hoping youll find good cause to whip them all.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: I think no less. Good morrow to your lordship. Now, sir, come on: what was done to Elbows wife, once more
Exit ANGELO

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Once, sir there was nothing done to her once.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: I beseech you, sir, ask him what this man did to my wife.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: I beseech your honour, ask me.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Well, sir what did this gentleman to her

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: I beseech you, sir, look in this gentlemans face. Good Master Froth, look upon his honour tis for a good purpose. Doth your honour mark his face

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Ay, sir, very well.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Nay I beseech you, mark it well.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Well, I do so.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Doth your honour see any harm in his face

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Why, no.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Ill be supposed upon a book, his face is the worst thing about him. Good, then if his face be the worst thing about him, how could Master Froth do the constables wife any harm I would know that of your honour.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Hes in the right. Constable, what say you to it

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: First, an it like you, the house is a respected house next, this is a respected fellow and his mistress is a respected woman.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: By this hand, sir, his wife is a more respected person than any of us all.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Varlet, thou liest thou liest, wicked varlet! the time has yet to come that she was ever respected with man, woman, or child.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, she was respected with him before he married with her.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Which is the wiser here Justice or Iniquity Is this true

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: O thou caitiff! O thou varlet! O thou wicked Hannibal! I respected with her before I was married to her! If ever I was respected with her, or she with me, let not your worship think me the poor dukes officer. Prove this, thou wicked Hannibal, or Ill have mine action of battery on thee.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: If he took you a box o the ear, you might have your action of slander too.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Marry, I thank your good worship for it. What ist your worships pleasure I shall do with this wicked caitiff

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Truly, officer, because he hath some offences in him that thou wouldst discover if thou couldst, let him continue in his courses till thou knowest what they are.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Marry, I thank your worship for it. Thou seest, thou wicked varlet, now, whats come upon thee: thou art to continue now, thou varlet thou art to continue.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Where were you born, friend

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: Here in Vienna, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Are you of fourscore pounds a year

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: Yes, ant please you, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: So. What trade are you of, sir

lines.speaker: pomphey
lines.text: Tapster a poor widows tapster.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Your mistress name

lines.speaker: pomphey
lines.text: Mistress Overdone.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Hath she had any more than one husband

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Nine, sir Overdone by the last.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Nine! Come hither to me, Master Froth. Master Froth, I would not have you acquainted with tapsters: they will draw you, Master Froth, and you will hang them. Get you gone, and let me hear no more of you.

lines.speaker: froth
lines.text: I thank your worship. For mine own part, I never come into any room in a taphouse, but I am drawn in.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Well, no more of it, Master Froth: farewell. Come you hither to me, Master tapster. Whats your name, Master tapster
Exit FROTH

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Pompey.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: What else

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Bum, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Troth, and your bum is the greatest thing about you so that in the beastliest sense you are Pompey the Great. Pompey, you are partly a bawd, Pompey, howsoever you colour it in being a tapster, are you not come, tell me true: it shall be the better for you.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Truly, sir, I am a poor fellow that would live.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: How would you live, Pompey by being a bawd What do you think of the trade, Pompey is it a lawful trade

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: If the law would allow it, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: But the law will not allow it, Pompey nor it shall not be allowed in Vienna.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Does your worship mean to geld and splay all the youth of the city

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: No, Pompey.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Truly, sir, in my poor opinion, they will tot then. If your worship will take order for the drabs and the knaves, you need not to fear the bawds.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: There are pretty orders beginning, I can tell you: it is but heading and hanging.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: If you head and hang all that offend that way but for ten year together, youll be glad to give out a commission for more heads: if this law hold in Vienna ten year, Ill rent the fairest house in it after threepence a bay: if you live to see this come to pass, say Pompey told you so.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Thank you, good Pompey and, in requital of your prophecy, hark you: I advise you, let me not find you before me again upon any complaint whatsoever no, not for dwelling where you do: if I do, Pompey, I shall beat you to your tent, and prove a shrewd Caesar to you in plain dealing, Pompey, I shall have you whipt: so, for this time, Pompey, fare you well.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: I thank your worship for your good counsel: but I shall follow it as the flesh and fortune shall better determine. Whip me No, no let carman whip his jade: The valiant heart is not whipt out of his trade.
Aside
Exit

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Come hither to me, Master Elbow come hither, Master constable. How long have you been in this place of constable

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Seven year and a half, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: I thought, by your readiness in the office, you had continued in it some time. You say, seven years together

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: And a half, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Alas, it hath been great pains to you. They do you wrong to put you so oft upon t: are there not men in your ward sufficient to serve it

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: Faith, sir, few of any wit in such matters: as they are chosen, they are glad to choose me for them I do it for some piece of money, and go through with all.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: Look you bring me in the names of some six or seven, the most sufficient of your parish.

lines.speaker: elbow
lines.text: To your worships house, sir

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: To my house. Fare you well. Whats oclock, think you
Exit ELBOW

lines.speaker: justice
lines.text: Eleven, sir.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: I pray you home to dinner with me.

lines.speaker: justice
lines.text: I humbly thank you.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: It grieves me for the death of Claudio But theres no remedy.

lines.speaker: justice
lines.text: Lord Angelo is severe.

lines.speaker: escalus
lines.text: It is but needful: Mercy is not itself, that oft looks so Pardon is still the nurse of second woe: But yet,poor Claudio! There is no remedy. Come, sir.
Exeunt
